task.title: Deleting an messaging group by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can delete messaging groups by using the group delete command on the command line.

taskbody.context: You can delete an messaging group by using the command line, or by using the . For more information about using the to delete an messaging group, see .

step.cmd: To delete an messaging group, enter the following command:
step.info:
The command must be capitalized as shown.
group delete "GroupID=GroupID"Where:
GroupID Specifies the group ID of the messaging group to delete.

taskbody.example: The following example shows deleting the messaging group TESTGROUP: group delete "GroupID=TESTGROUP" The requested configuration change has completed successfully.
